intro: Lactuca kanitziana, commonly known as the Kanitz's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family (Asteraceae). It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb that thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly studied species.
